abstract: Redesigned SAT faces scrutiny after tutors and members of test-prep industry identify two questions that contain overtly negative stereotypes towards women and girls; despite claims of gender bias claims over test contents, College Board officials reassert fairness of exam and report results of May 7th testing did not have significant difference between girls and boys.
lead_paragraph: Some critics said two items on the newly revamped exam were unfair to girls, but College Board officials said the test had been thoroughly vetted, leading to scores that showed no bias.

headline.main: Tutors See Stereotypes and Gender Bias in SAT. Testers See None of the Above.
headline.print_headline: Tutors See Stereotypes and Gender Bias in SAT. Testers See None of the Above.

snippet: Some critics said two items on the newly revamped exam were unfair to girls, but College Board officials said the test had been thoroughly vetted, leading to scores that showed no bias.
